intro: Piriqueta capensis, commonly known as the Cape piriqueta, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its fleshy, succulent leaves and small, star-shaped flowers that bloom in shades of yellow and orange. It thrives in sandy, well-drained soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid climates. Piriqueta capensis is often found in coastal and rocky areas, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
